title: Cheesecake
description: A perfect cheesecake, sweet and rich just enough.
story:
After baking cheesecake for many many times, this is the recipe I like the most.

I adjusted the richeness to my taste as well as sweetenes. Worth spending extra time on proper baking and cooling, since it makes the cheescake creamy and without cracks on top.

ingredients.name: cream cheese
ingredients.preparationNotes: (I take equal parts of Mascarpone, Ricotta and Cream cheese

instructions: Prepare the springform pan (18"): I lay springform pan with parchment paper and wrap in aluminum foil from the outside (so that I could put it in a water bath)
Crush cookies and nuts and chocolate and combine everything with melted butter. Put on the bottom of the springform pan.
Once crust is baked, take it out. Lower oven temperature to 165 C (325 F).
Mix cream cheese with sugar and milk, add eggs one at a time, add sour cream, vanilla and corn starch. Mix everything. No whipping.
Put the springform onto the baking sheet (take the one that is deeper). Fill baking sheet with hot boiling water.
Bake for 1 hour. The cake will be very soft (almost runny) in the middle.
Then turn off the oven and let the cheesecake to stay in the oven for another hour. After that, leave the oven door ajar and let cool completely.
I like to serve it with a raspberry jam or shredded chocolate.
